39447533.review:
Great conclusion in an outstanding feel-good point&click adventure game series.

I thoroughly enjoyed all 3 installments of The Journey Down. It's mellow and unique atmosphere, fantastic setting and overall easy riddles makes it a great relaxing adventure. The VO, music and visual art direction gives the series a unique face, yet feeding a bit off nostalgica from 90s games that too utilized the mixture of pre-rendered 3D and hand-drawn game environments. 

The Journey Down delivers a classic story arc which I found very comforting. It doesn't overstep it's boundaries and handles the topics respectful without overdoing it politically or morally. It stays true to it's adventure roots and promise on a Journey Down to the Underland. 

A game that brightens grey and stormy winter days and leaves a smile upon your face whenever Bwana and Kito have one of their silly dialogues, usually involving some kind of prank.

39377209.review:
Insgesamt gelungener, optisch schöner Abschluss der Reihe, der jedoch unter seinem deutlich zu niedrigen Schwierigkeitsgrad und der sehr hohen Erzählgeschwindigkeit leidet. Für Fans der Reihe selbstverständlich ein absolutes Muss, jedoch hätte es diesem Abschluss gut getan, wenn das Spiel sich mehr Zeit für seine Story gelassen und diese durch interessantere Rätsel aufgelockert hätte.

Hätte also besser sein können. Das macht es aber zum Glück noch nicht schlecht.

39339591.review: Extremely easy puzzles, lame characters, tons of cheesy references to adventure game classics. It was a boring game with tons of deus ex machina story connections. The only good thing was the art style and some of the musics.

39323423.review: This is the final chapter of the Journey Down, and concludes the adventures of Lina, Bwana, and Kito. Much like the first two, the animation is fun, the characters make for humorous dialogue, and the music is fun to listen to. The Journey Down has always been a pretty easy to understand game, but it is story rich. The atmosphere is interesting, and the characters are easy to get into. Play this to complete the story, especially if you loved the first two chapters!

39131884.review: A lot of fun and great humor

38949500.review: Played the first two chapters and i loved them. So waited for chapter three and bought on sale. I really want to leave a positive review but sadly this chapter sucks compared to other two. Very short game. Could have finish it under 2 hours and request a refund. Feels like the last actions in the story are done in a rush as they all happen so fast that some doesn't even make any sense and nothing gives the thrill of a good ending. [spoiler]Literary the snake god is snatched by the eagle god and that's it. No fight or anything and the almighty god is gone.[/spoiler] Worst ending ever. Does not worth the money even on sale. Really disappointed as they ruined an awesome trilogy :(

38697336.review:
After playing the first two games I eagerly awaiting the third chapter. Starting the game I was dumped unceremoniously into the game, I had to go to YouTube for a quick recap.

The game itself continued with it's excellent style, atmosphere and unique story. The puzzles were pedestrian, the usual fetch style quests making you go back and forth to progress forwards.

Overall, it was on par with the other two chapters but not really ground breaking.

38682219.review:
Loved it from the begining to the end !
A very fun point & click that will set you on good vibe !
A true work of love from the dev.
Thanks for putting this together after 10 years of work !
Definitely recommend for adventure point & click  game lovers !

Pros :
- great visual art
- nice soundtrack
- good mood
- nice voice acting

Cons :
- Ending could have been a bit better

38682002.review:
[b]Erster Spieldurchlauf mit der German BETA[/b]
Der Anfang fühlt sich noch etwas geschnitten an, da man plötzlich in einer Höhle steht, aber je weiter man spielt, desto klarer wird wie unnötige eine lange Reise durchs Unterland gewesen wäre, das Spiel heißt schließlich nicht "The Long Journey Down"
Das Spiel löst alle offenen Fragen und rundet die ganze Geschichte gelungen ab. Die Rätsel sind einfach aber nicht zu einfach, frustration sollte für halbwegs erfahrene Adventure Spiele nicht aufkommen, die Hinweise sind gut platziert und da man (meines Wissens nach) keine Hotspottaste hat, muss man auch wie früher den Bildschirm absuchen. Die Grafik wurde nochmal aufpoliert, aber rucklige Zwischensequenzen kommen immer noch vor, wodurch sich Ton und Bild verschieben, auch sind manche Sprites sehr verschwommen. Wer dieses Problem in JD2 hatte, wird es auch in JD3 haben. Musikalisch ist es überragend, sie verschmilzt förmlich mit dem Visuellen und kann vie Bandcamp erworben werden, mehr Infos dazu am Ende des Spiels. 

Pros:
- Animation und Auflösung der Hauptcharaktere
- Musik und Sprecher
- Geringer frustrations Faktor

Cons:
- Zwischensequenzen werden nicht immer flüssig abgespielt
- Animierte 2D Objekte sind bei 1080p stark verwaschen

38342286.review: Point and click gold. Highly reccomend to anyone into adventure games. Kings quest/grimfandango -esque. Start with chapter one, and you will be hooked.

38157770.review: Enjoyed it - funny story, puzzles are good.

37719283.review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.
Plus de détails en bas.

---

Troisième et dernière partie de cet excellent point&click, qui clôt l'aventure correctement !

Mon avis reste le même que pour les deux autres parties : les puzzles sont simples, les doublages sont bons et les dialogues présentent une touche d'humour. La musique jazz-reggae est un point positif du jeu, elle est fort agréable. Compter environ 4h pour finir le troisième épisode, en avançant tranquillement.

Note: le jeu n'est pas disponible en français.

---

La version Linux est excellente. Aucun soucis rencontré.

OS: Linux Mint 18.2 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

37431602.review:
The Journey Down: Chapter 3 termine admirablement bien la saga The Journey Down !

L’histoire y est bien racontée et nous dévoile peu à peu les fils de sa trame, jusqu’à aboutir à une fin aussi épique que sympathique ! L’aventure a évolué au fur et à mesure des épisodes, devenant de plus en plus complexe, proposant des énigmes au juste niveau de difficulté, avec quelques variations bien placées pour ne pas qu’on se lasse.

Si on reprend l’entièreté de l’aventure The Journey Down, je ne peux donc que vous la recommander si vous aimez les point ‘n clicks : avec son ambiance décontractée, ses personnages farfelus et sa mécanique simple mais efficace, c’est un voyage fabuleux !

+ Histoire rocambolesque et entraînante
+ Ambiance détendue, pleine d'humour
+ Graphismes colorés et complets
+ Les quelques variations dans les énigmes
+ On peut jouer Lina (un peu)

- Aucune rejouabilité
- Absence complète d'indices
- Cinématiques très (trop) gourmandes en affichage

37309492.review: The team really pulled out something special for the final chapter. I loved the much more varied locations there's some really amazing background art.  The story is tight and compelling and really comes together for an awesome ending. The team put so much into this and it really shows.

36884443.review: Yet another stellar chapter in the Journey Down saga! If you're a fan of PnC adventures it is a must play!

36670207.review: Very enjoyable, challenging puzzles that are rewarding. Incredible soundtrack and the art direction is impeccible.

36455284.review: This is a very entertaining game - part puzzle, part comedy and every bit as serious. The storyline is blended well with a proper mix of humor and underlying tones of major social issues that face us all every day. Although I'm still working my way through the first part of the story, I was immediately taken by the visual quality, voice acting and mechanics. *gameplay still in progress*

36434574.review: I enjoyed chapters 1 and 2 and I love the imagery and the soundtrack.  The storyline seemed to drag a little bit in Chapter 3, but I still found the game entertaining.   The puzzles aren't terribly challening, and the gameplay makes it impossible to choose an ill-fated path.    It was a nice easy-going game.    I would say that it's best to start at Chapter 1--buy the bundle if you haven't already started with the series.   I do think you can solve the puzzles without having to refer back to the first two chapters, but the story is probably going to be less interesting without starting from the top.

36280069.review:
Hello everybody, End World Gaming here to share an excerpt from my review for The Journey Down: Chapter 3 by SkyGoblin.

Well folks, we’ve officially arrived at the conclusion to The Journey Down. Chapter 3 picks up where chapter 2 left off with Bwana, Kito and Lina arriving in the underland. While there, they uncover the Armando Power Company’s true plot and thus set out on a journey to stop them. Bwana and Kito return to St. Armando and team up with a band known as the Resistance Rockers while Lina stays in The Underland to stop the power company’s mining.

This chapter was highly entertaining and it was definitely the funniest chapter of the 3. One thing that’s worth mentioning is that because of the original composer having died during the development 2 (Which sucks) this chapter has a very different feel music wise. It’s still very good but a lot of the Afro-Caribbean feel is lost in this chapter.

The game’s graphics are as gorgeous as ever and it’s unique hand drawn 2D backgrounds mixed with it’s 3D characters are very impressive to look at. I especially loved the backgrounds for The Underland. I also really liked the 1980’s style cyberpunk theme that was used for St. Armando. It added to the rather bleak outlook that the game took on and it fit the story very well.

Puzzle wise they were slightly more difficult this time around. Mostly because there were multiple areas for both St. Armando and The Underland which made finding some of the items a bit more difficult since they weren’t overly obvious. They weren’t too difficult to figure out but I recommend searching everywhere possible and in every nook and cranny.

Overall, The Journey Down Chapter 3 was a very entertaining end to a great journey. It was the culmination of the many years of work that went into making the series and while the music was slightly different, it features a great story and likable characters. I highly recommend playing the previous games before this one to get the most out of it. If you’re a fan of point and click adventure games like myself, I highly recommend this series, it’s pretty epic.

If you'd like to check out the full review and find out my final score for the game, you can find the review here: http://www.endworldgaming.com/adventure/the-journey-down-chapter-3-review

Happy gaming folks!

36092905.review:
Мое знакомство с серией The Journey Down началось, к сожалению, именно с третьего, и вполне возможно, что заключительного эпизода. Я впервые в жизни начинал знакомится с историей и опасался, что не смогу вникнуть во все детали, оттуда и общей картинки правильных красочных впечатлений - не получу.

Но мои опасения раскрошились сразу же после первой главы. Этот квест невероятно простой, интуитивный и максимально релаксовый. Персонажи мне уже сейчас напоминают просто счастливых людей, вроде Лебовски, которые просто живут, кайфуют, занимаются любимыми делами и ни о чем не думают. Утонченное и восхитительнейшее музыкальное сопровождение только подкрепляет общую сочность. Ты как-будто попадаешь и ловишь красивую теплую волну, которую океан мыслей разработчиков тебе дарит.

Вся музыка была записана специально для этой игры вживую, музыкантами. Тягучий ночной джаз, легкий рок с нотками электричества в воздухе, рэгги... Настолько душевно записанной вручную музыки я давно не встречал.

Но главное что здесь есть - это юмор: игра им просто пропитана. Кроме того, ребята постарались, и все грубые матерные ругательства завуалировали под схожие по звучанию слова. Так, что если за игру возьмется ребенок - он ничего не поймет и все останется в рамках возрастного рейтинга. А если взрослый - то посмеется.

А теперь минусы: я не могу сказать с уверенностью, что это не только у меня, но. В игре при появлении кат-сцен звук, не смотря на настройки в меню - у меня повышался до максимума. Приходилось прикручивать до практически нуля, ибо колонки взрывались, а потом откручивать обратно. Это невероятно неудобно, и надеюсь это было только у меня, ибо такая непроверенная штука в этой фантастической игре - портит ее донельзя :(

Но все же, я крайне рекомендую каждому прикоснуться к этому красивому расслабляющему приключению, чарующему своим юмором и тонко подобранной музыкой.

35877310.review:
An awesome ending for an awesome series. Even better graphics and locations than chapter 2. 
None of the puzzles were too hard or too obscure to solve. 
No glitches, bugs or crashing on my end.

And a very top notch sound track!

35873444.review: i wish i could describe all the reasons why i am unhappy with this game, but its just too many

35873048.review:
The exciting conclusion of the Journey Down trilogy. It's been a fun ride and I enjoyed every second of it. In this adventure we meet new and old characters and finally find out what the bad guys evil plans are.

* This is a more casual game more about the fun story than hard puzzles that make you pull your hair out.

* The characters are all fun and have really good voice actors.

* The music is amazing as always. I could just sit on the main menu and listen to the music all day.

* I liked how the story swaps between characters giving you two different adventures.

* The ending was and epic fun ride and even brings back memories of how it all started.

I hope to see more adventures in the future from SkyGoblin. :)

35810311.review: A final conclusion in the series. Great voices, great art, great story! I loved this series.

35790812.review: This is fun if fairly straightforward and short adventure. A nice ending to The Journey Down trilogy. Like the great tunes, this is a laid-back finale. Play it if you liked the first two.

35754848.review:
A simple but solid point and click adventure finishing the story started years ago. I had a blast with this episode (same with the previous ones): crazy humor, simple but fulfilling puzzles and wacky characters.

The story is a bit formulaeic, but you got to go with the flow here, man. :)

Pure fun, but play first the original chapters, otherwise you will have no idea what is going on. And have fun.

35726961.review:
So after playing through all 3 games I would give this game 6/10 compared to other adventure games I like (monkey island, deponia).

Music & ambience  - 7/10 (a bit too jazzy at some scenes, good reggae vibes) 
Graphics - 6/10   
Controls & navigation - 6/10 You can skip a lot of talking, but after having played newer adventure games it is expected 
                                                that you should be able to skip whole scenes or the whole convo if you misclick. Also the 
                                                inventory wasn't too fancy. 
Story  -5/10  Intrigued at first, but then the storyline felt like my shortstories from jr high. :D 
Characters: 6/10
Difficulty - Easy

Overall enjoyable, thanks.

35711247.review:
终于通关了，虽然是看攻略的，花了足足三个半小时。游戏是好游戏，无论是从它的背景音乐还是剧情上看，都是不容错过的作品。记得好几年前（大概是2015年吧），我从贴吧上看到了这个解谜游戏，因为我个人是十分喜欢这类科学解谜类游戏，我就毫不犹豫的上网到处找最终才找到了这游戏的破解版，这游戏实在太冷门，冷门到几乎没有哪里可以找到攻略。（当时的我还不知道有steam这么一个平台）就这样玩了破解版第一二章，诶，人物设定很新奇，背景音乐很赞，当时的我英文水平还很渣，拿着一个电子辞典，查陌生的单词，最终经过我的努力，再加之网上终于找到的攻略（要感谢一下攻略的作者，MaGtRo大大），终于是通关了，第二章尾声设在了Underland的大门口，Lina的最后一句“OUR ADVENTURE BEGINS!”让我更加期待第三章，终于，第三章在9月21日在steam正式发售，第一时间，趁着打折，把三章都买下来了，决定把前两章都再通关一次，这次，玩的不是破解版。经过几天的努力，三章都被我征服了，在这里呢，我不想剧透，还是希望大家自己去经历这个历险，我本以为第三章都会在Underland里进行，结果主角Bwana又回到了ST. ARMANDO，去阻止他们的邪恶计划。整个游戏就如同在看一部电影。
另外，这个游戏对中国的玩家很不友好，长篇的英文，大量的生僻词汇，我玩起来也很吃力。还有，第三章设置里的Click-to-continue选项怎么消失了，没这个选项，大量的对话转瞬即逝，还没理解句意就过去了，希望游戏工作组出中文！！！WE NEED CHINESE!!!
另外，我已经为这个游戏提名了“超乎想象”奖项，好游戏，应该的。

35706094.review:
Alla som kommer ihåg den första filmen om Lejonkungen, Grim Fandango, och Monkey Island 2, räck upp en hand! (Och alla av dessa som gillade filmen och spelen kan gå direkt till Köp utan att passera Gå.)
The Journey Down är en trilogi av äventyrsspel som följer samma grundprinciper som LucasArts klassiska äventyrsspel från 90-talet. Huvudpersonen blir aldrig dödad, man fastnar aldrig på ett sånt sätt att man måste ladda en tidigare sparning - och vartenda steg i äventyret dryper av humor.
Även om jag kanske har en och annan invändning mot textredigeringen så törs jag ändå påstå att få spel från en såpass liten studio tenderar att bli så här bra. Och det är inte ovanligt att spel från större studior är sämre underhållning! Väl värt priset, åtminstone ur kvalitetssynpunkt.

(Min ända undran är om det egentligen var meningen att få med så många referenser till Blade Runner, eller om det bara är jag som när en viss besatthet.)

35668599.review: The Journey Down has been a really entertaining adventure from beginning to end and I am sad that it has come to a close. This final chapter rounded off the story really well and it was good to be back in the role of Bwana causing the usual mayhem and rolling out the witty dialogue. There was another good mix of characters, some returning and some new, but all well voice acted as in the previous chapters. The soundtrack was fantastic as always and the longer cutscenes added nicely to the story. The only downside I can really see is that it was a little on the short side but overall it was a good conclusion to the series and I would recommend it to any fan of point and click games!

35667498.review: Awesome ending of awesome story, Funny and nice. Puzzle is not complicated and reasonable. Try to play it, and you definitely will like it.

35655551.review:
Somewhat shorter than chapter two the game have really interesting progression, from trying to make an old airplace work in the first chapter which have simple Caribbean settings to something that looks like a post apocalyptic future yet still in the 80s, with sky pirates, ancient deities, and totalitarian regime.  

I really like the way it all developed from the beginning to the end and they put a big emphasis on the ending which I think its the most important part, as I played many games that were really nice but the ending was a huge disappointment. Love the graphics in this game, especially the cutscenes which had a lot of work put into them. 
I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes point and click advantre games now that all 3 chapters are out.

The only down side is that at parts the puzzles might be a bit too simple, as if they weren't really meant to challenge anyone but just to increase the overall number of puzzles in the game (4 bit security system puzzle), and specifically in this chapter I can't think of any really challenging ones. But this can be a good thing for novice or casual players while the more experienced ones can just enjoy the story progression.

35633220.review:
A fitting conclusion to an excellent trilogy of adventure games.  Once again, Skygoblin have delivered a well-written and entertaining title with an outstanding soundtrack, solid puzzle design (towards the easy side of things, but not in a bad way), a great cast of actors, interesting and varied art design, and a lot of heart.  Well worth playing, but playing the previous games first is a requirement.

Playtime is probably around 4-6 hours, depending on your adventure game experience.  This review only shows 1 hour for me, as most of my playtime was offline.

35631421.review: This chapter of the game did not disappoint. Would Def recommend this game series for others to play. I have played the first two chapters of this game & the main characters are still batty as hell, LOL.  Game coverage was done in two parts @ https://www.twitch.tv/videos/179091261 and https://www.twitch.tv/videos/179223141.

35588095.review: A fitting and beautiful conclusion to a fun little adventure game series. I love the music, the characters, the goofy hijinks, it's great. Definitely recommended!

35567121.review: A soulful, beautiful conclusion to one of the more original and captivating point and click adventures of recent years. It falls short of all-time-classic status, but it will bring a huge smile on your face with the sheer heart + soul evident in it's every pixel.

35558639.review: Great game and ending to a fun series

35526302.review:
Great finish to the series! The third and final chapter maintains the quality of the first two previous chapters with good voice acting and interesting characters. It is also bigger with more locations and closes off the story in a satisfying way. 
Even so there are some parts and characters that are not introduced probably or feels a bit "tacked on". It is not enough to spoil the experience though!

35521546.review: I completed the game and this chapter is my favorite
